books.name: Maharam Agenda
books.description: Founded in 1902, Maharam evolved from a pushcart business on the Lower East Side into a leading global textile resource for architects and interior designers. Four randomized cover variations.
books.Note: This item is no longer available and will not be reordered.

books.name: Maharam Stories
books.description: Maharam Stories brings together a broad range of revealing and engaging design observations from luminaries such as Murray Moss, Hans Ulrich Obrist, John Pawson, Alice Rawsthorn, Michael Rock, Stefan Sagmeister, and more - packaged in a compelling design.
books.Note: This item is no longer available and will not be reordered.

books.name: Irving Harper Works in Paper
books.description: Known for his mid-century creation of the Marshmallow Sofa, Ball Clock, and Herman Miller logo as George Nelson Associates' director of design, Irving Harper made hundreds of rarely seen paper sculptures in his spare time from 1963-2000.

image: ./img/new/Books/Hella Jongerius I Don't Have a Favourite Color.png
books.name: Hella Jongerius: I Don’t Have a Favourite Colour
books.description: Hella Jongerius describes her method of research and application to Vitra products.

books.name: Reproducing Scholten & Baijings
books.description: The first monograph on Dutch design duo Stefan Scholten and Carole Baijings takes an in-depth look at their research-intensive, hands-on, and iterative approach to making as demonstrated across seven case studies including those with 1616/Arita Japan, MINI, Georg Jensen, and Maharam.

books.name: Alexander Girard
books.description: A monograph on seminal designer Alexander Girard and his distinctive career.

books.name: Claudy Jongstra
books.description: This volume explore's Claudy Jonstra's distinctive, sustainable approach and provides an overview on her career.

books.name: The Colors of Sies Marjan
books.description: A colorful, comprehensive volume documenting the short-lived but highly influencial work of Sander Lak's beloved and now cult fashion brand, Sies Marjan.

books.name: Karel Martens: Full Colour
books.description: An intimate and  in-depth photographic documentation of the prolific Dutch graphic design of Karel Martens.

books.name: Studio Job & The Groninger Museum
books.description: The book traces a survey at the Groninger Museum in the Netherlands featuring ten years of work by Job Smeets and Nynke Tynagel, including the Bavaria Marquette series and Ruins on the end pages.

books.name: Irma Boom: Colour Based on Nature
books.description: Colour Based on Nature takes the concept of Irma Boom's previous work further afield, highlighting UNESCO World Heritage sites across the globe and on every continent.

books.name: Jacob Hashimoto: Selected Kite Works & Installations
Ilse Crawford: A Frame for Life
books.description: Ilse Crawford showcases her body of influential, holistic work,articulating her philosophies for design and living. Featuring StudioIlse’s work from private residences to hotels,restaurants, and retail this book illustrates the effectiveness of design grounded in human needs and desires.

books.name: Knoll Textiles: 1945-2010
books.description: A comprehensive study of Knoll’s innovative textile design and the company’s role within the history of interior design.

books.name: Textilepedia
books.description: An extensive textile dictionary that covers all essential fabric knowledge from different types of textile materials to finishing options.

image: ./img/new/The Autobiography of a Snake- Drawings by Andy Warhol.jpg
books.name: The Autobiography of a Snake: Drawings by Andy Warhol
books.description: The story of a snake trying to make it in the world of sixties high-society. Illustrations by Andy Warhol, afterword written by Arthur and Teddy Edelman.

image: ./img/new/A Coloring Book- Drawings by Andy Warhol.jpg
books.name: A Coloring Book: Drawings by Andy Warhol
books.description: An enchanting colorbook designed by Andy Warhol. Foreward written by Arthur and Teddy Edelman.

books.name: Hella Jonggerius: It All Starts With a Yarn
books.description: This book celebrates Nick Cave’s collection with Knoll Textiles and shows insight into his creative process. Created by Bob Faust and Nick Cave. There are two versions of this book, one with a Big Floral Wrap cover and one without.

books.name: The Nick Cave Collection
books.description: This book celebrates Nick Cave’s collection with Knoll Textiles and shows insight into his creative process. Created by Bob Faust and Nick Cave. There are two versions of this book, one with a Big Floral Wrap cover and one without.
